title: travelplanner: Could you create a 5-day travel plan for two people, beginning in Newark and visiting 2 cities in Wisconsin from March 13th to March 17th, 2022? Our budget is set at $2,700 and we prefer to stay in shared rooms. (791562b49b637436)

always_included_messages.content:
Based on the user's query, make the best travel plan for the user and save it. Do not ask follow-up questions.
Use your best judgement in finding alternatives if possible. Don't give up - ALWAYS save a plan with the `submit_day_plan` function for each day of the trip!

chat_history.name: restaurant_search

chat_history.content:
# Day 1

## Travel:
- A flight from Newark to Madison leaves at 18:26 and arrives at 19:56, with an actual elapsed time of 2 hours and 30 minutes. This will cost $355.

## Accommodation:
- You can stay in a shared room in Madison for $164 per night.

## Attractions:
- The Madison Children's Museum is open daily from 9:30 am to 5 pm.
- Olbrich Botanical Gardens is open from 10 am to 5 pm.
- The Madison Museum of Contemporary Art is open from 11 am to 5 pm.

## Food:
- The 99 North Restaurant offers fast food, Mexican, Indian and pizza for an average cost of $62.
- Otik Cake Shop offers desserts, pizza, BBQ, American and seafood for an average cost of $24.
- Nik's Kitchen has tea, Italian, BBQ, Mediterranean and seafood for an average cost of $10.

# Day 2

## Travel:
- There should be plenty of time to explore Madison more today before journeying to your next location.

## Accommodation:
- As there is no information regarding accommodation in the other cities in Wisconsin, I have kept your accommodation as Madison for this day.

## Attractions:
- The Wisconsin State Capitol building is open daily from 8 am to 6 pm.
- The Wisconsin Veterans Museum is open from 9 am to 4:30 pm.
- The Wisconsin Science Museum is open from 10 am to 5 pm.

## Food:
- The Grandson of Tunday Kababi offers fast food, bakery, American and seafood for an average cost of $36.
- Food Scouts offers tea, cafe, pizza, bakery and Chinese food for an average cost of $17.
- Tongue Thai'd serves bakery, pizza, American and fast food for an average cost of $78.

# Day 3

## Travel:
- Journey on to the next city in Wisconsin (I have chosen Green Bay due to its proximity to Madison).

## Accommodation:
- I have been unable to find any shared rooms in Green Bay, but a private room could cost as little as $22 per night.

## Attractions:
- Resch Center is a sports complex which is home to the Green Bay Blizzard.
- Bay Beach Amusement Park is a funfair park with a range of rollercoasters and rides.
- Lambeau Field is a football stadium and the home field of the Green Bay Packers.

## Food:
- The Green Bay Whitehurst is a restaurant with a pub-like atmosphere.
- 1919 Kitchen & Tap is a restaurant with a bar and lounge area.
- Republic Chophouse prides itself on its steaks.

# Day 4

## Travel:
- Spend your last full day in Wisconsin exploring Green Bay.

## Accommodation:
- As mentioned previously, I have been unable to find any shared rooms in Green Bay.

## Attractions:
- The National Railroad Museum is a railway museum with a range of locomotives and train-related exhibits.
- The Green Bay Botanical Garden is a botanical garden with a range of plants and flowers.
- The NEW Zoo is a zoo with a range of animals and wildlife.

## Food:
- Plae Bistro is a restaurant with a focus on local ingredients.
- The Black & Tan Grille is a steakhouse and bar.
- Angelina is an Italian restaurant.

# Day 5

## Travel:
- Today is your last day in Wisconsin and you will need to fly back to Newark.

## Accommodation:
- N/A

## Attractions:
- N/A

## Food:
- N/A

## Flights:
- I have been unable to find any return flights from Green Bay to Newark.

I have been unable to find any shared rooms in Green Bay, and return flights from Green Bay to Newark. I am also unable to find any other cities in Wisconsin that are easily accessible from Madison.

## Plan saved.

functions.name: accommodation_search
functions.desc:
Discover accommodations in your desired city.
Example: accommodation_search("Rome") would present a list of hotel rooms in Rome.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking accommodation.

functions.name: attraction_search
functions.desc:
Find attractions in a city of your choice.
Example: attraction_search("London") would return attractions in London.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking attractions.

functions.name: city_search
functions.desc:
Find cities in a state of your choice.
Example: city_search("California") would return cities in California.

state.description: The name of the state where you're seeking cities.

functions.name: flight_search
functions.desc:
A flight information retrieval tool.
Example: flight_search("New York", "London", "2022-10-01") would fetch flights from New York to London on October 1, 2022.

departure_city.description: The city you'll be flying out from.

destination_city.description: The city you aim to reach.

date.description: The date of your travel in YYYY-MM-DD format.

functions.name: google_distance_matrix
functions.desc:
Estimate the distance, time and cost between two cities.
Example: google_distance_matrix("Paris", "Lyon", "self-driving") would provide driving distance, time and cost between Paris and Lyon.

origin.description: The departure city of your journey.

destination.description: The destination city of your journey.

functions.name: restaurant_search
functions.desc:
Explore dining options in a city of your choice.
Example: restaurant_search("Tokyo") would show a curated list of restaurants in Tokyo.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking restaurants.

functions.name: submit_day_plan
functions.desc:
Once you have collected information about the trip, call this function once for each day of the trip, starting on day 1.
If a field does not apply for a given day, use "-" to indicate this.
You MUST call this function to save the plan for each query.

current_city.description: The city for this day. If the plan is to travel between two cities, indicate it as "from A to B" (e.g. "from Ithaca to Charlotte").

transportation.description: e.g. "Flight Number: F3633413, from Ithaca to Charlotte, Departure Time: 05:38, Arrival Time: 07:46"

breakfast.description: The name of a restaurant in the city, e.g. "Nagaland's Kitchen, Charlotte"

attraction.description: Use a ";" to separate different attractions, with each attraction formatted as "Name, City". e.g. "The Charlotte Museum of History, Charlotte;"

accommodation.description: e.g. "Affordable Spacious Refurbished Room in Bushwick!, Charlotte"
